text: Pranjal Bhumij (born 2 March 1999) is an Indian professional footballer who plays as a forward for Mumbai City FC in the Indian Super League. Although Pranjal prefers playing as a striker, he can also play as a winger on either side and as an attacking midfielder. ==Career== A youth product for DSK Shivajians, Bhumij made his professional debut for the first-team in the I-League on 26 February 2017 against Churchill Brothers. He came off the bench in the 60th minute for Naro Hari Shrestha as DSK Shivajians fell 3–0. He then scored his first professional goal for the club on 8 April 2017 against Shillong Lajong. He scored the equalizing goal for the club in the 63rd minute but despite that, Shillong Lajong scored a third in stoppage time to win 3–2. ===Mumbai City FC=== On 23 July 2017, Pranjal has been picked up by Mumbai City FC as a Developmental player for 2017-18 Hero ISL season. ==International career== In August 2017, Pranjal was called by India U19 coach Floyd Pinto before SAFF U19 Championship.
